original: sems can gyi rigs rnams dang po nyid nas sangs rgyas yin te /
analyzed: sems can gyi rigs rnams dang po nyid nas sangs rgyas yin te /
translated: The types of sentient beings are Buddhas from the very beginning.

original: de nyid dang po nyid nas glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pas bsgoms pas ma rtogs te /
analyzed: de nyid dang po nyid nas glo bur gyi rnam par rtog pas bsgoms pas ma rtogs te /
translated: They are not realized because of being obscured by adventitious conceptual thoughts from the very beginning.

original: rang nyid sangs rgyas yin pa ma shes so //
analyzed: rang nyid sangs rgyas yin pa ma shes so //
translated: They do not know that they themselves are Buddhas.üîΩThat itself is the supreme stainless state,

original: de nyid dri ma med pa'i mchog / sems kyi ngo bo nyid byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de nyid dri ma med pa'i mchog / sems kyi ngo bo nyid byang chub kyi rang bzhin yin te /
translated: the nature of mind is the nature of enlightenment,

original: dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po thams cad 'dzin pa spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from grasping at all things.üîΩThe supreme trunk of the nondual mind

original: gnyis med sems kyi sdong po mchog / sa gsum ma lus khyab par son //
analyzed: gnyis med sems kyi sdong po mchog / sa gsum ma lus khyab par son //
translated: pervades the three worlds without exception.

original: snying rje'i me tog @206b 'bras bu 'dzin //
analyzed: snying rje'i me tog @206b 'bras bu 'dzin //
translated: It bears the flowers and fruits of compassion.

original: ming ni gzhan la phan pa'o //
analyzed: ming ni gzhan la phan pa'o //
translated: Its name is benefiting others.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: This is what he says.üîΩüîΩ

original: de ltar mchog gi don bstan nas gzhan la phan pa ston te /
analyzed: de ltar mchog gi don bstan nas gzhan la phan pa ston te /
translated: Thus, having taught the meaning of the supreme, he teaches the benefit for others.

original: rnal 'byor ba'i sems gang gnyis su med pa ni dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin du khams gsum ma lus par khyab par son pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba'i sems gang gnyis su med pa ni dpag bsam gyi shing bzhin du khams gsum ma lus par khyab par son pa ste /
translated: The mind of the yogi, which is nondual, is like a wish-fulfilling tree, pervading the three realms without exception.

original: thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad gnyis su med pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúall nondual‚Äù is that.

original: de'i snying rje'i me tog gi 'bras bu'i ming ni gzhan la phan pa ste /
analyzed: de'i snying rje'i me tog gi 'bras bu'i ming ni gzhan la phan pa ste /
translated: The fruit of the flower of compassion is the benefit for others.

original: thams cad kyi thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la sogs pa rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thams cad du sangs rgyas kyi byang chub la sogs pa rgyas par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it causes the expansion of the enlightenment of the buddhas, and so on, in every way.

original: stod pa'i sdong po me tog skyes //
analyzed: stod pa'i sdong po me tog skyes //
translated: The trunk of praise produces flowers.

original: snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung//
analyzed: snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs 'byung//
translated: Compassion arises in various ways.

original: lhun grub gzhan gyi 'bras bu ste //
analyzed: lhun grub gzhan gyi 'bras bu ste //
translated: The fruit of others is spontaneously present.

original: bde ba 'di ni sems gzhan min //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bde ba 'di ni sems gzhan min //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
translated: This bliss is not another mind.

original: de ltar stong pa'i 'bras bu snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mi 'dod bzhin du yang bsam pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar stong pa'i 'bras bu snying rje rnam pa sna tshogs kyis mi 'dod bzhin du yang bsam pa sna tshogs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, the result of emptiness is compassion, which, without being desired, fulfills the various wishes of beings.

original: 'on kyang yongs su rdzogs pa'i snying rje ston pa ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang yongs su rdzogs pa'i snying rje ston pa ni /
translated: However, the teaching of perfect compassion is as follows:

original: stong pa'i sdong po snying rje min //
analyzed: stong pa'i sdong po snying rje min //
translated: The trunk of emptiness is not compassion.

original: gang la rtsa ba lo 'dab med //
analyzed: gang la rtsa ba lo 'dab med //
translated: What has no root or leaves?

original: de la dmigs byed gang yin pa //
analyzed: de la dmigs byed gang yin pa //
translated: What is the agent of observation?

original: de ni lhung nas yal ga chag / ces gsungs te /
analyzed: de ni lhung nas yal ga chag / ces gsungs te /
translated: It falls and the branches are destroyed.

original: stong pa'i sdong po snying rje min pa ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir 'dir dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje la snying rje min pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa'i sdong po snying rje min pa ni stong pa dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i phyir 'dir dmigs pa med pa'i snying rje la snying rje min pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The trunk of emptiness is not compassion because emptiness and compassion are inseparable. Here, compassion without observation is called ‚Äúnot compassion.‚Äù

original: stong pa nyid kyi sdong po de la rtsa ba dang lo 'dab med do //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi sdong po de la rtsa ba dang lo 'dab med do //
translated: That trunk of emptiness has no root or leaves.

original: sgom pa dang sgom pa po dang / bsgom bya gdod ma nas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgom pa dang sgom pa po dang / bsgom bya gdod ma nas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation do not exist from the beginning.

original: de la dmigs bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni lhung nas yal ga chag pa ni khams gsum gcig ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
analyzed: de la dmigs bar byed pa gang yin pa de ni lhung nas yal ga chag pa ni khams gsum gcig ba'i ngo bo nyid yin pas so //
translated: That which is observed there is fallen, because the branches are broken, since the three realms are of the nature of oneness.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: sa bon gcig la sdong po gnyis //
analyzed: sa bon gcig la sdong po gnyis //
translated: From a single seed, two trunksüîΩFrom a single seed, two trunks grow,üîΩand from those two trunks, a single flower grows.

original: ltos pa med pas me tog gcig /'dir ni dbyer med gang mthong ste //
analyzed: ltos pa med pas me tog gcig /'dir ni dbyer med gang mthong ste //
translated: Here, one sees the inseparability

original: srid dang mya ngan 'das las grol //üîΩzhes gsungs te /
analyzed: srid dang mya ngan 'das las grol // zhes gsungs te /
translated: of cyclic existence and nirvana.

original: sa bon gcig la sdong po dang yal ga'i bye brag gnyis skye ste /
analyzed: sa bon gcig la sdong po dang yal ga'i bye brag gnyis skye ste /
translated: From a single seed, two trunks grow, with the distinction of branches.

original: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyu dang 'bras bu rnam pa gnyis su 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, there are two aspects of cause and effect.

original: de yang 'bras bu las tha mi dad do //
analyzed: de yang 'bras bu las tha mi dad do //
translated: Moreover, the effect is not different from the cause.

original: rgyu de lta bu las 'bras bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang 'khor ba dbyer med par mthong ba de ni thar par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyu de lta bu las 'bras bu'o zhes gsungs pa'i phyir sangs rgyas dang 'khor ba dbyer med par mthong ba de ni thar par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, one who sees that buddhahood and cyclic existence are inseparable attains liberation,

original: gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgang zhig 'dod pa @207a * //
analyzed: gnyis su med par rtogs pa'i phyir ro // gang zhig 'dod pa @207a * //
translated: because of realizing the non-duality of the two.üîΩOne who is desirous of the light

original: can 'od tshe //
analyzed: can 'od tshe //
translated: of the moon

original: de ni re ba med song nas //
analyzed: de ni re ba med song nas //
translated: goes without hope.

original: kham por dum bu blangs nas ni //
analyzed: kham por dum bu blangs nas ni //
translated: Taking a morsel from the dust-heap,

original: kye ho rang khyim bor la song //
analyzed: kye ho rang khyim bor la song //
translated: Ah! Abandoning your own home, go!

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Thus it is said.

original: gong du bstan ba'i don mtha' dag 'khor ba'i longs spyod la chags pa med pa de'i tshe rtogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong du bstan ba'i don mtha' dag 'khor ba'i longs spyod la chags pa med pa de'i tshe rtogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: When one is without attachment to the enjoyments of cyclic existence, then one will understand the meaning of all that has been taught above.

original: longs spyod la chags pa dang bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa yang dag par rgyas pa ni sbrul gyi dug dang 'dra bar gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: longs spyod la chags pa dang bu dang tsha bo la sogs pa yang dag par rgyas pa ni sbrul gyi dug dang 'dra bar gnod pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Attachment to enjoyments and the true expansion of sons, grandsons, and so on, are harmful like the poison of a snake.

original: de'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pas 'dod pa can slong ba'i mi 'ongs pa'i tshe /
analyzed: de'i phyir snying rje dang ldan pas 'dod pa can slong ba'i mi 'ongs pa'i tshe /
translated: Therefore, when a compassionate one sees a man who is a beggar,

original: bdag nyid srid pa'i dbang gis cung zad kyang mi ster na nga la dngos grub mi 'byung ngo zhes bsams nas rang gi khyim nas thon te phyir bor ba'i kham por blangs nas longs spyod la chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: bdag nyid srid pa'i dbang gis cung zad kyang mi ster na nga la dngos grub mi 'byung ngo zhes bsams nas rang gi khyim nas thon te phyir bor ba'i kham por blangs nas longs spyod la chags par mi bya'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: if he does not give him anything out of the power of his existence, thinking that he will not attain power, then he should leave his own home and take a morsel from the dust-heap, and not be attached to enjoyments. This is the meaning.

original: de bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that,üîΩhe says,

original: gzhan la phan pa ma byas shing //
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa ma byas shing //
translated: Not having helped others,

original: 'dod pa la ni mi ster ba //
analyzed: 'dod pa la ni mi ster ba //
translated: But not to give to those who want it.

original: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu gang //üîΩde bas ring por byas na rung //
analyzed: 'di ni 'khor ba'i 'bras bu gang // de bas ring por byas na rung //
translated: This is the fruit of cyclic existence.

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, it is right to keep it far away.

original: gzhan la phan pa ma nus na khyim dang longs spyod kyi dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa ma nus na khyim dang longs spyod kyi dgos pa ci yod /
translated: If one is not able to help others, what is the use of a home and wealth?

original: gal te gser la sogs pa'i nor yod pa sbyin par mi gtong na 'khor bar gnas pa la nor der 'bras bu med ces bya'o //
analyzed: gal te gser la sogs pa'i nor yod pa sbyin par mi gtong na 'khor bar gnas pa la nor der 'bras bu med ces bya'o //
translated: If one has wealth such as gold and does not give it away, then that wealth is useless for remaining in cyclic existence.

original: de'i tshe rang nyid bor ba byas na rung gi khyim nas 'thon la lus dang srog la mi lta bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang nyid bor ba byas na rung gi khyim nas 'thon la lus dang srog la mi lta bar gnas so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: At that time, it is right to abandon oneself. The meaning is that one should leave home and live without regard for body and life.

original: byis pa'o skye bo rnams kyi dor do ha mdzod kyi t'i ka dka' ba'i don 'grel byas pa'o //
analyzed: byis pa'o skye bo rnams kyi dor do ha mdzod kyi t'i ka dka' ba'i don 'grel byas pa'o //
translated: This is the commentary on the difficult points of the Treasury of Doha Verses by the child Saraha.

original: rang gis go bar bya ba'i phyir //
analyzed: rang gis go bar bya ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to bring about understanding for myself,

original: dka' 'grel byas pa 'di yis ni //
analyzed: dka' 'grel byas pa 'di yis ni //
translated: I have composed this commentary on the difficult points.

original: ming ni bdag nyid go byed pa //
analyzed: ming ni bdag nyid go byed pa //
translated: The name itself brings understanding.

original: bla ma brgyud ri ma gsal byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma brgyud ri ma gsal byed pa'o //
translated: It clarifies the lineage of gurus.

original: gang tshe gzhan gyis bltas nas kyang //
analyzed: gang tshe gzhan gyis bltas nas kyang //
translated: When others look at it,

original: de tshe de la phan gyur na //
analyzed: de tshe de la phan gyur na //
translated: If it is of benefit to them,

original: de na sems can don gyur yin //
analyzed: de na sems can don gyur yin //
translated: then it is of benefit to sentient beings.

original: de lta min na bzod par zhu //
analyzed: de lta min na bzod par zhu //
translated: If not, then I ask for your forgiveness.

original: rang gi don dang gzhan don du //
analyzed: rang gi don dang gzhan don du //
translated: For the sake of myself and others,

original: bdag gis 'di byas bsod nams kyis //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di byas bsod nams kyis //
translated: through the merit of my actions,

original: de yis 'jig rten thams cad kun //
analyzed: de yis 'jig rten thams cad kun //
translated: may the entire worldüîΩattain self-arisen wisdom.

original: rang byung ye shes thob par shog / do ha mdzod kyi dka' 'grel slob dpon chen po dpal gnyis su med pa'i rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rang byung ye shes thob par shog / do ha mdzod kyi dka' 'grel slob dpon chen po dpal gnyis su med pa'i rdo rjes mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the Treasury of DohƒÅs composed by the great master ≈örƒ´ Advaya-vajra is complete.

original: // rgya gar lho phyogs yul ko sa lar sku 'khrungs pa'i rnal 'byor pa chen po shr'i bee ro tsa na badzras bsgyur ba'o /
analyzed: // rgya gar lho phyogs yul ko sa lar sku 'khrungs pa'i rnal 'byor pa chen po shr'i bee ro tsa na badzras bsgyur ba'o /
translated: It was translated by the great yogin ≈örƒ´ Vairocanavajra, who was born in the southern land of Kosala.
